thread.name: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can try

email.subject: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can try

text.signature: Edward N. Krapels, PhD Director, Gas and Power Services ESAI www.esai.com tel 781 245 2036

email.subject: RE: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can try

text.sentence: old fashioned way!
The file comes across as winmail.dat
not as a .doc
file or a .pdf
file.
It happens in the case of some E-mail systems: the files get encoded and then they don't get decoded correctly.

email.subject: RE: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can

text.sentence: yes, that's happened to us before.
The fax is on its way.
I'll be going home soon to go to one of my kid's events so we can talk or correspond by email at your convenience.
Bye..

email.subject: RE: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can try the

text.sentence: Ed, I got your fax.
Thanks for your kind words about Enron.
Every business hits turbulence from time to time but I am not losing sleep over it.
I am a bit concerned about the last two paragraphs and references to LTCM and MG.
I am afraid they can be taken out of context and misinterpreted.

email.subject: RE: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can

text.sentence: Vince, Thanks for your comments.
I will adapt the memo to our clients to make it more neutral.
I find myself in an interesting position -- you may recall meeting one of my associates during one of our DC seminars that you attended.
He is now working for Larry Lindsay at the White House and I was with him on Friday.

He asked for my views on the situation and I demurred, saying I did not have enough information to make an informed estimate of whether this might turn into an energy equivalent of LTCM (the MG situation was quite different in its structural aspects).
Anyway, I am trying to be helpful here... I realize your company can call DC any time and present the situation but it may be useful to have someone like me as a side channel.
If I can be useful in this channel let me know.
All the best.

email.subject: RE: Here from scratch ... what's your fax #... we can try the

text.sentence: Ed, Thanks.
I have forwarded your message to Mark Palmer, our press spokesman.
He has a full plate, as you might expect, but I strongly suggested that he should get in touch with you.
Thank you Vince.
I have sent you one more version this morning.
I hope you have that.
We are not a newspaper so it is not necessary for us to bother your press spokesman.
I would be happy to keep in touch with you if you would find that useful.
In any event, I will treat this email exchange as a private matter between old (in more ways than one!) friends.
